image.altText: A man looks onto a destroyed and burnt out house.

props.synopsis: More than 350 structures have been destroyed by several bushfires burning across Victoria, authorities say, as residents return home to take stock of the devastation.

title.children: More than 350 structures lost to Vic bushfires as locals assess damage

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a suit and blue tie, and black-rimmed glasses. He stares intently just past the camera.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has recalled parliament early to deal with sweeping hate speech and gun laws in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: PM recalls parliament to introduce hate speech and gun laws

image.altText: A close-up photo of a woman's face

props.synopsis: The future of Adelaide Writers' Week (AWW) remains unclear as Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says she is considering her legal options. Former New Zealand prime minister Jacinda Ardern is among those who will no longer appear at the event.

title.children: Adelaide Writers' Week 'hangs in the balance' as Jacinda Ardern joins list of authors boycotting event

image.altText: An older man with glasses, white hair and a mauve tie stands in front of several American national and government flags.

props.synopsis: The US attorney's office in the District of Columbia has opened a criminal investigation into Jerome Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve.

title.children: 'This won't end well': US Fed Reserve chair facing criminal probe

image.altText: A woman gestures during a press conference in front of a European Union banner.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says controlling Greenland is crucial for US national security and he has suggested using force to seize the Arctic territory.

title.children: Danish PM says Greenland feud at a 'decisive moment' after new Trump threats

image.altText: A blurry image of a crowd of protesters at night surrounding burnt vehicles

props.synopsis: Iranians have endured a blackout but for many the fears of atrocities committed by the Khamenei regime are real and based on reports of machine guns being used.

title.children: If Iran is 'done with this regime' could the son of the former Shah return?

image.altText: Duct-tape panels on camouflage fabric with straps sitting on short brick fence, foliage behind

props.synopsis: A man allegedly carrying a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi has been arrested and charged by NSW Police, with his vest examined by the bomb disposal unit and deemed safe.

title.children: Man fronts court over duct taped vest near Bondi Beach

image.altText: An imam smiles against a green, leafy backdrop.

props.synopsis: An imam who was allegedly the victim of racial abuse during a roadside assault has thanked the police who helped him and his wife, and urged Australians to reject hate, Islamophobia and antisemitism.

title.children: Imam thanks police after alleged roadside assault in Melbourne

image.altText: A woman in white accepts an award.

props.synopsis: This year's Golden Globes saw hits and misses for Australia, last-minute snubs and a humbled Timothée Chalamet.

title.children: Golden Globes key moments: Chalamet bests Dicaprio, Rose Byrne shouts out her bearded dragon

props.synopsis: The Taliban's chief spokesman agreed to an unscripted, sit-down interview with me, there was just one non-negotiable condition, writes Meghna Bali.

title.children: More than the US and UK, the Taliban has an issue with Australia

image.altText: A person with their face covered holds a sign that reads 'abolish ice'

props.synopsis: Minneapolis had been the target of a massive immigration enforcement operation in the weeks leading up to Renee Nicole Good's death. Now, the shooting has opened old wounds.

title.children: Why Minneapolis was the place where ICE launched its largest operation yet

image.altText: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott attends the ceremony to mark one year since bondi junction westfield stabbing attack

props.synopsis: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, who was praised for bringing the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack to an end, has been diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of breast cancer.

title.children: 'The hero of Bondi Junction' stabbing attack diagnosed with rare cancer

image.altText: close-up of guns lying on a table.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government says it does not support the Commonwealth's proposed national gun buyback scheme, stating the territory should not have to share the cost 50:50.

title.children: NT rejects national gun buyback scheme over co-funding proposal

image.altText: Marta Kostyuk holds a trophy

props.synopsis: Marta Kostyuk explained that not shaking Aryna Sabalenka's hand and talking about Ukraine following her Brisbane International defeat was her duty, and to not highlight the issues at home would be "inhumane".

title.children: 'It's not okay to not talk about it': Kostyuk explains handshake stance

image.altText: A police car parked on the side of the road in front of a run-down house.

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway after a woman was found dead at a house in Buccan, south of Brisbane.

title.children: Investigation underway after woman found dead at Logan home

image.altText: Woman holds packet of illegal cigarettes and lighter.

props.synopsis: An eastern states public health expert says "it's a mystery" why Western Australia is lagging behind the rest of the country on updating its illicit tobacco laws.

title.children: WA authorities still powerless to shut down illicit tobacco and vape shops

image.altText: Koren and her friends having lunch outside, they're smiling.

props.synopsis: I've kept low-cost, high-fun habits alive for years, even after returning home to a city where socialising often seems to mean shelling out.

title.children: How I have fun with friends without spending money

image.altText: A main street with two graphics of a KFC sign and a McDonald's sign on either side of the image.

props.synopsis: Nutrition, vibe and culture concerns fuel these communities that want to protect their suburbs' identity and businesses from the fast food giants.

title.children: 'We can't survive it': The suburbs fighting against fast food giants

image.altText: A graphic of a female athlete throwing a javelin with a dollar sign on it

props.synopsis: Low pay, discrimination, disordered eating, sexism and online abuse are just a few of the prevalent issues ABC's Elite Athletes in Women's Sport Survey has revealed, despite recent progress in women's sport.

title.children: Elite sportswomen have shared their stories, and these are the hard truths

image.altText: Hands holding bottle of ArmaForce.

props.synopsis: A popular supplement linked to hundreds of adverse events is again in the spotlight after a Perth woman was hospitalised after taking over-the-counter herbal remedy ArmaForce.

title.children: Perth woman suffers severe reaction after taking herbal remedy ArmaForce

image.altText: A yellow and purple car impounded by police.

props.synopsis: A major police operation at Summernats has resulted in 19 vehicle seizures, hundreds of traffic offences and multiple arrests.

title.children: Police seize 19 vehicles after dangerous driving at Summernats

image.altText: One police officer either side of a police car about to get into the car

props.synopsis: Officers have issued another plea to Kenneth John Giles to surrender, with the 58-year-old unsighted since Wednesday evenings shooting in Mullewa.

title.children: Police confirm multiple shots in Mullewa incident, renew plea to alleged gunman

image.altText: A man in a light purple apron and a black t-shirt stirs sliced onions in a saucepan on a stovetop.

props.synopsis: If you're a food lover, chances are you've heard of the Michelin Guide – you may have even dined at a Michelin-starred restaurant, but not here in Australia.

title.children: Why there are no Michelin-starred restaurants in Australia

image.altText: Peter Manlinauskas is wearing a suit and flanked by two mothers holding babies while standing in a yard

props.synopsis: Families will be able to access fertility treatment rebates of up to $2,000 per cycle for two cycles, under a Labor promise announced ahead of the upcoming state election.

title.children: Labor pledges fertility treatment rebates ahead of election

image.altText: A woman standing in front of a map of Australia.

props.synopsis: Resources Minister Madeleine King's comments come amid a growing furore over the decision that has led several board members to resign and dozens of writers to withdraw from the Adelaide literary event.

title.children: Federal minister backs axing of Palestinian author from writers' festival

image.altText: People gathering at a big colourful music and food festival.

props.synopsis: A federal assistant minister and two Tasmanian state Labor MPs apologise after a complaint was made about their behaviour at the Taste of Summer festival in Hobart.

title.children: Assistant minister for women apologises for 'shoot, shag or marry' game at festival

image.altText: piles of rubbish, tents and misc camping equipment on a large patch of grass

props.synopsis: With campsite trash accounting for more than half of the rubbish accumulated at music festivals, there are calls for a "cultural shift" in the behaviour of those attending.

title.children: Walking through post-festival camp full of abandoned gear feels like 'shopping'

image.altText: A scientist with a microscope.

props.synopsis: When Queen Elizabeth II used a product on her royal tour of Australia in 1963, journalists noticed. Then everyone wanted to use it.

title.children: The Aussie invention made famous by Queen Elizabeth II

image.altText: flooding over road

props.synopsis: Authorities have issued a Flood Emergency Warning for the central Queensland town of Clermont as large parts of the state are on flood watch in the wake of ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

title.children: Flood emergency warning for central Qld town as ex-Cyclone Koji moves inland

image.altText: Two white Wegovy prescription medicine boxes seen on a turquoise surface.

props.synopsis: The cost of weight loss drug Wegovy will soon be massively subsidised for Australians with severe obesity who have had a stroke or heart attack.

title.children: Ozempic-like drug to be listed on PBS for people with severe obesity

image.altText: Woman with bob haircut sits on a purple chair in an empty doctor waiting room.

props.synopsis: The percentage of GP clinics fully bulk-billing has almost doubled, according to a new report, however, the government says the data cannot be relied on.

title.children: Bulk-billing rates have almost doubled, report indicates

image.altText: Tower demolition at Bell Bay Power Station, Tasmania

props.synopsis: It took just 41 kilograms of explosives and less than a minute — a remnant of the 1970s fossil fuel age is blown to bits to make way for a methanol fuel plant.

title.children: Kaboom signals move to renewables as power station tower crashes down

image.altText: Image of strips of paper scrunched into the shape of a brain. The paper says words like "stress" and "anxiety".

props.synopsis: Everyone experiences intrusive thoughts, and most people can brush them off without a worry. But what happens when those intrusive thoughts become inescapable?

title.children: How 'hidden thoughts' can be a sign of OCD in some people
